Orginal: Japan began the defence of their Asian Cup title with a lucky 2-1 win against Syria in a Group C championship match on Friday .
Test_Case: JAPAN BEGAN THE DEFENCE OF THEIR ASIAN CUP TITLE WITH A LUCKY 2-1 WIN AGAINST SYRIA IN A GROUP C CHAMPIONSHIP MATCH ON FRIDAY .

Orginal: But China saw their luck desert them in the second match of the group , crashing to a surprise 2-0 defeat to newcomers Uzbekistan .
Test_Case: BUT CHINA SAW THEIR LUCK DESERT THEM IN THE SECOND MATCH OF THE GROUP , CRASHING TO A SURPRISE 2-0 DEFEAT TO NEWCOMERS UZBEKISTAN .

Orginal: China controlled most of the match and saw several chances missed until the 78th minute when Uzbek striker Igor Shkvyrin took advantage of a misdirected defensive header to lob the ball over the advancing Chinese keeper and into an empty net .
Test_Case: CHINA CONTROLLED MOST OF THE MATCH AND SAW SEVERAL CHANCES MISSED UNTIL THE 78TH MINUTE WHEN UZBEK STRIKER IGOR SHKVYRIN TOOK ADVANTAGE OF A MISDIRECTED DEFENSIVE HEADER TO LOB THE BALL OVER THE ADVANCING CHINESE KEEPER AND INTO AN EMPTY NET .

Orginal: Oleg Shatskiku made sure of the win in injury time , hitting an unstoppable left foot shot from just outside the area .
Test_Case: OLEG SHATSKIKU MADE SURE OF THE WIN IN INJURY TIME , HITTING AN UNSTOPPABLE LEFT FOOT SHOT FROM JUST OUTSIDE THE AREA .

Orginal: The former Soviet republic was playing in an Asian Cup finals tie for the first time .
Test_Case: THE FORMER SOVIET REPUBLIC WAS PLAYING IN AN ASIAN CUP FINALS TIE FOR THE FIRST TIME .

Orginal: Despite winning the Asian Games title two years ago , Uzbekistan are in the finals as outsiders .
Test_Case: DESPITE WINNING THE ASIAN GAMES TITLE TWO YEARS AGO , UZBEKISTAN ARE IN THE FINALS AS OUTSIDERS .

Orginal: Two goals from defensive errors in the last six minutes allowed Japan to come from behind and collect all three points from their opening meeting against Syria .
Test_Case: TWO GOALS FROM DEFENSIVE ERRORS IN THE LAST SIX MINUTES ALLOWED JAPAN TO COME FROM BEHIND AND COLLECT ALL THREE POINTS FROM THEIR OPENING MEETING AGAINST SYRIA .

Orginal: Takuya Takagi scored the winner in the 88th minute , rising to head a Hiroshige Yanagimoto cross towards the Syrian goal which goalkeeper Salem Bitar appeared to have covered but then allowed to slip into the net .
Test_Case: TAKUYA TAKAGI SCORED THE WINNER IN THE 88TH MINUTE , RISING TO HEAD A HIROSHIGE YANAGIMOTO CROSS TOWARDS THE SYRIAN GOAL WHICH GOALKEEPER SALEM BITAR APPEARED TO HAVE COVERED BUT THEN ALLOWED TO SLIP INTO THE NET .

Orginal: It was the second costly blunder by Syria in four minutes .
Test_Case: IT WAS THE SECOND COSTLY BLUNDER BY SYRIA IN FOUR MINUTES .

Orginal: Defender Hassan Abbas rose to intercept a long ball into the area in the 84th minute but only managed to divert it into the top corner of Bitar 's goal .
Test_Case: DEFENDER HASSAN ABBAS ROSE TO INTERCEPT A LONG BALL INTO THE AREA IN THE 84TH MINUTE BUT ONLY MANAGED TO DIVERT IT INTO THE TOP CORNER OF BITAR 'S GOAL .

Orginal: Nader Jokhadar had given Syria the lead with a well-struck header in the seventh minute .
Test_Case: NADER JOKHADAR HAD GIVEN SYRIA THE LEAD WITH A WELL-STRUCK HEADER IN THE SEVENTH MINUTE .

Orginal: Japan then laid siege to the Syrian penalty area for most of the game but rarely breached the Syrian defence .
Test_Case: JAPAN THEN LAID SIEGE TO THE SYRIAN PENALTY AREA FOR MOST OF THE GAME BUT RARELY BREACHED THE SYRIAN DEFENCE .

Orginal: Bitar pulled off fine saves whenever they did .
Test_Case: BITAR PULLED OFF FINE SAVES WHENEVER THEY DID .

Orginal: Japan coach Shu Kamo said : ' ' The Syrian own goal proved lucky for us .
Test_Case: JAPAN COACH SHU KAMO SAID : ' ' THE SYRIAN OWN GOAL PROVED LUCKY FOR US .

Orginal: The Syrians scored early and then played defensively and adopted long balls which made it hard for us . '
Test_Case: THE SYRIANS SCORED EARLY AND THEN PLAYED DEFENSIVELY AND ADOPTED LONG BALLS WHICH MADE IT HARD FOR US . '

Orginal: Japan , co-hosts of the World Cup in 2002 and ranked 20th in the world by FIFA , are favourites to regain their title here .
Test_Case: JAPAN , CO-HOSTS OF THE WORLD CUP IN 2002 AND RANKED 20TH IN THE WORLD BY FIFA , ARE FAVOURITES TO REGAIN THEIR TITLE HERE .

Test_Case: ALL FOUR TEAMS ARE LEVEL WITH ONE POINT EACH FROM ONE GAME .
